assignments.title: Programming Summative
assignments.description:
Subject-specific Knowledge:
Interaction between JavaScript programs and the Document Object Model (DOM)
Using control statements to loop and make decisions.
An understanding of the nature of imperative programming in the object-oriented style.
A knowledge and understanding of good programming practice (for example, reuse, documentation and style)

Key Skills:
an ability to recognise and apply the principles of abstraction and modelling
Tasks
Choose a sketch from openprocessing.org
Adapt it into a reusable component using JavaScript classes

Appropriate constructor:
Get and set methods for properties
draw method with optional p5.Renderer as parameter
Build an example page with properties controlled by form controls
Write documentation of your code using Markdown
assignments.blurb: p5 Programming assignment worth 35% of the module

markingCategories.title: Usability of code
markingCategories.description: This is all about how reusable your code is

markingCategories.title: Development of Original
markingCategories.description: All about how much you improved the original code

markingCategories.title: Quality of Example
markingCategories.description: This is about gow good your example was in showcasing your finished code

markingCategories.title: Quality Documentation
markingCategories.description: This is all about how well documented your code is

markingCategories.title: Code Quality
markingCategories.description: This is about how good your code is

markingCategories.title: Second Category
markingCategories.description: This is about how good your code is

markingCriteria.subtitle: Appropriate Parameterisation
markingCriteria.description: This is for the quality of the usability of the parameterisation.  It's more about making parameterisation that is easy to work with rather than good for the customisation of component

markingCriteria.subtitle: Encapsulation
markingCriteria.description: The quality of the abstraction of the class.  This means appropriate private fields and appropriate methods to control them safely.

markingCriteria.subtitle: Useful Methods (Encapsulation of Methods)
markingCriteria.description: This is the quality of the methods that the component has and how easy it is to interact with

markingCriteria.subtitle: Original Code was Submitted
markingCriteria.description: For this criteria 100% is to be given if the original code was submitted and 0% otherwise

markingCriteria.subtitle: Refactored to Class
markingCriteria.description: This criteria is for refactoring the original work into a class.  This is not only the quality of the abstraction of the submitted class but also the difference from the original (if the original is perfectly abstract then this criteria isn't met)

markingCriteria.subtitle: Parameterisation
markingCriteria.description: This criteria is about how well the finished code is parameterised.  If there are a lot of parameters that the user (programmer implementing the code) can control to make meaningful changes to the component

markingCriteria.subtitle: Extending Scope
markingCriteria.description: This criteria is about how much was done to add to the component.  If the component is identical in function to the original then  0%.  Subjectively, if work is done to add meaningful feathers(not trivial implementation) the work should be awarded a good mark

markingCriteria.subtitle: Valid HTML
markingCriteria.description: The code is to be put through a HTML validator, and then given a mark based on the number of errors.  The marker ought to read through the errors that exist to confirm that they are in fact avoidable

markingCriteria.subtitle: Appropriate Instructions
markingCriteria.description: This is a basic user experience criteria, whether the example has explanations giving a user critical information on the user of the component

markingCriteria.subtitle: Appropriate Controls
markingCriteria.description: The example page has appropriate components to control the component

markingCriteria.subtitle: Block Documentation
markingCriteria.description: All methods have jsDoc comments explaining their the role of the method, its parameters and return

markingCriteria.subtitle: Explanation of example
markingCriteria.description: The implementation of the example is explained

markingCriteria.subtitle: Licences
markingCriteria.description: The source of original code and any code that was used is acknowledged

markingCriteria.subtitle: ESLint
markingCriteria.description: This criteria is about how well the code does in ESLint.

markingCriteria.subtitle: Possible Errors
markingCriteria.description: This is a negative marking criteria for any issues (potentially unsafe code) that can be found

markingCriteria.subtitle: Best Practices
markingCriteria.description: Check if there exists any needlessly slow or awful code.

markingCriteria.subtitle: Variables
markingCriteria.description: If the variable identifiers are meaningful

markingCriteria.subtitle: Style
markingCriteria.description: This is to do with the code style.  This means the formatting that doesn't affect how the code runs.

markingCriteria.subtitle: ECMScript 6
markingCriteria.description: If the ECMScript 6 syntax was used over older, still valid, js

markingCriteria.subtitle: First Criteria
markingCriteria.description: Some words 1
